metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9273 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In ProFTPD 1.3.7, it is possible to corrupt the memory pool by interrupting the data transfer channel. This triggers a use-after-free in alloc_pool in pool.c, and possible remote code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9273` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

proftpd-basic - 1.3.6c-1
proftpd-mod-geoip - 1.3.6c-1
proftpd-mod-ldap - 1.3.6c-1
proftpd-mod-mysql - 1.3.6c-1
proftpd-mod-odbc - 1.3.6c-1
proftpd-mod-pgsql - 1.3.6c-1
proftpd-mod-snmp - 1.3.6c-1
proftpd-mod-sqlite - 1.3.6c-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: proftpd-dfsg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.6c-1').
